item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, October 4, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Getting my daily news from a dot matrix printer (476 points | 152 comments)
2. Meta Movie Gen (713 points | 641 comments)
3. Teenage hacker became a legend attacking companies, then his rivals attacked him (34 points | 8 comments)
4. Show HN: One – A new React framework unifying web, native and local-first (308 points | 105 comments)
5. 12 Months of Mandarin (295 points | 166 comments)
6. Mitmproxy 11: Full HTTP/3 Support (40 points | 3 comments)
7. How were 70s versions of games like Pong built without a programmable computer? (39 points | 20 comments)
8. The other British invasion: how UK lingo conquered the US (47 points | 65 comments)
9. Show HN: FFmpeg-over-IP – Connect to remote FFmpeg servers (63 points | 29 comments)
10. Carma (YC W24) Is Hiring Software Engineers to Get Fleets Same-Day Auto Repair ( | hide)
11. Show HN: Chebyshev approximation calculator (211 points | 36 comments)
12. Experimental web browser optimized for rabbit-holing (497 points | 98 comments)
13. Why does man print "gimme gimme gimme" at 00:30? (2017) (869 points | 368 comments)
14. ESP32: leaving love notes and entering demoscene territory (2022) (108 points | 11 comments)
15. LLMs, Theory of Mind, and Cheryl's Birthday (6 points | discuss)
16. Insider Trader Had All the Answers (14 points | 4 comments)
17. Show HN: open source framework OpenAI uses for Advanced Voice (50 points | 5 comments)
18. Bureaucrat Mode (44 points | 24 comments)
19. Computer scientists combine two 'beautiful' proof methods (64 points | 12 comments)
20. If You Meet ET in Space, Kill Him (4 points | 1 comment)
21. Show HN: A tool for creating chord charts on the go (107 points | 29 comments)
22. ESP8266 Analog Broadcast Television Interface (88 points | 15 comments)
23. Max Schrems wins privacy case against Meta over data on sexual orientation (42 points | 28 comments)
24. Self-locking and stiffening deployable tubular structures (49 points | 5 comments)
25. Show HN: kew – A Terminal Music Player for Linux (113 points | 49 comments)
26. Reverse engineering and dismantling Kekz headphones (176 points | 32 comments)
27. Knowledge Growth and Specialization: Evidence from Oncologists (37 points | 2 comments)
28. Wikipedia and Wikidata as sources for analyzing Americanization (23 points | 1 comment)
29. Robert Dennard, DRAM Pioneer, has died (331 points | 27 comments)
30. Α phase-locked auditory stimulation to treat symptoms of sleep onset insomnia (3 points | 1 comment)
